review: Got mine last night. The good. Super easy to set up and nice clean interface. Pretty zippy too (faster than the roku stick). Three problems so far that I am hoping are just early launch bugs 1) I have a nexus 5 phone and can "cast" my screen. That works but video playback is awful. 2) I downloaded the remote app for my android and it couldn't find it when it searched for devices, and 3) allcast didn't work for me either. I was connected to the same WiFi network on my phone and my fire stick, FYI. Other than that, pretty cool. Id probably reccomend this over the roku stick.
author: chiefsfan1230

review: What a great product! I had previously purchased the Chromecast for use on our main TV in the living room to stream material from a tablet or my smartphone. I have a Fire TV in our bedroom that I use on a regular basis. When I got notice of the discounted Fire TV stick, I jumped on it. Since receiving the Fire TV Stick I have not used the Chromecast a single time.The Fire TV Stick works almost as good as the Fire TV. Out of the box the only difference is the size, the lack of a voice control remote, and the speed. The size is nice because it plugs into the back of the TV and you never see it again. The lack of voice control is not an issue, since I use the Fire TV App to control the stick. The speed difference between the Stick and Fire TV is minimal. If you did not use the Fire TV before the stick, you wouldn't even notice it. As far as the apps, it has everything I would use on the Chromecast except HBOGO.The only problems I have had are getting familiar with the Fire TV app. It is difficult to use at first, but becomes easier with practice.Overall, it is one of the better "Tech" products I have purchased over the past few years. In fact I purchased a few as gifts for family members for Christmas (Although, I purchase them through Best Buy who was having an awesome sale on them).
